briefTitle: Comparison of Entecavir to Adefovir in Chronic Hepatitis B Virus (HBV) Patients With Hepatic Decompensation
officialTitle: Comparison of the Efficacy and Safety of Entecavir Versus Adefovir in Subjects Chronically Infected With Hepatitis B Virus and Evidence of Hepatic Decompensation
summary: This is a phase IIIb comparative study of entecavir 1.0 mg once daily (QD) vs. adefovir 10 mg QD in patients who have chronic hepatitis B infection and hepatic decompensation. The patients are treated for 96 weeks after the last subject is randomized.

primaryOutcome.measure: Change From Baseline in Hepatitis B Virus (HBV) DNA by Polymerase Chain Reaction (PCR) at Week 24
